t: Exodus 15
The Song of Moses

Then*p Moses and the children of Israel sang this song to the Lord,*s and spoke, saying: “I*pn will sing to the Lord,*s For*ld He has triumphed gloriously! The*ld horse and its rider He*ld has thrown into the sea!
The*ld Lord*s is*i my strength and song, And*ld He has become my salvation; He*ld is*i my God, and I will praise Him; My*ld father’s God, and I will exalt Him.
The*ld Lord*s is*i a man of war; The*ld Lord*s is*i His name.
Pharaoh’s*ld chariots and his army He has cast into the sea; His*ld chosen captains also are drowned in the Red Sea.
The*ld depths have covered them; They*ld sank to the bottom like a stone.
“Your*ln right hand, O Lord,*s has become glorious in power; Your*ld right hand, O Lord,*s has dashed the enemy in pieces.
And*ld in the greatness of Your excellence You*ld have overthrown those who rose against You; You*ld sent forth Your wrath; It*ld consumed them like stubble.
And*ld with the blast of Your nostrils The*ld waters were gathered together; The*ld floods stood upright like a heap; The*ld depths congealed in the heart of the sea.
The*ld enemy said, ‘I will pursue, I*ld will overtake, I*ld will divide the spoil; My*ld desire shall be satisfied on them. I*ld will draw my sword, My*ld hand shall destroy them.’
You*ld blew with Your wind, The*ld sea covered them; They*ld sank like lead in the mighty waters.
“Who*ln is*i like You, O Lord,*s among the gods? Who*ld is*i like You, glorious in holiness, Fearful*ld in praises, doing wonders?
You*ld stretched out Your right hand; The*ld earth swallowed them.
You*ld in Your mercy have led forth The*ld people whom You have redeemed; You*ld have guided them*i in Your strength To*ld Your holy habitation.
“The*ln people will hear and*i be afraid; Sorrow*ld will take hold of the inhabitants of Philistia.
Then*ld the chiefs of Edom will be dismayed; The*ld mighty men of Moab, Trembling*ld will take hold of them; All*ld the inhabitants of Canaan will melt away.

Fear*ld and dread will fall on them; By*ld the greatness of Your arm They*ld will be as*i still as a stone, Till*ld Your people pass over, O Lord,*s Till*ld the people pass over Whom*ld You have purchased.

You*ld will bring them in and plant them In*ld the mountain of Your inheritance, In*ild the place, O Lord,*s which*i You have made For*ld Your own dwelling, The*ld sanctuary, O Lord, which*i Your hands have established.
“The*ln Lord*s shall reign forever and ever.”

For*p the horses of Pharaoh went with his chariots and his horsemen into the sea, and the Lord*s brought back the waters of the sea upon them. But the children of Israel went on dry land*i in the midst of the sea.
The Song of Miriam
Then*p Miriam the prophetess, the sister of Aaron, took the timbrel in her hand; and all the women went out after her with timbrels and with dances.
And Miriam answered them: “Sing*pn to the Lord,*s For*ld He has triumphed gloriously! The*ld horse and its rider He*ld has thrown into the sea!”
Bitter Waters Made Sweet
So*p Moses brought Israel from the Red Sea; then they went out into the Wilderness of Shur. And they went three days in the wilderness and found no water.
Now when they came to Marah, they could not drink the waters of Marah, for they were*i bitter. Therefore the name of it was called Marah.
And the people complained against Moses, saying, “What shall we drink?”

So he cried out to the Lord,*s and the Lord*s showed him a tree. When he cast it*i into the waters, the waters were made sweet. There*p He made a statute and an ordinance for them, and there He tested them,

and said, “If you diligently heed the voice of the Lord*s your God and do what is right in His sight, give ear to His commandments and keep all His statutes, I will put none of the diseases on you which I have brought on the Egyptians. For I am*i the Lord*s who heals you.”
Then*p they came to Elim, where there were*i twelve wells of water and seventy palm trees; so they camped there by the waters.
